title-group.article-title: The Impact of Asymmetric Information and Ownership on Nursing Home Access

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 2005 Springer Science + Business Media, Inc.

abstract.p: A consistent pattern in the nursing home industry is that non-profit institutions serve a lower proportion of Medicaid patients than do for-profit facilities. This is contrary to the expectation that non-profit, altruistically motivated firms should serve a larger proportion of the less profitable Medicaid patients than proprietary firms. The literature confirms this pattern empirically, but provides no theoretical basis for it, which is the contribution of this paper. Specifically, we show theoretically that information disparities between providers and consumers regarding quality fosters an environment in which the percentage of uninformed consumers is a key factor in determining public-private patient mix.
